intro: Goniolimon graminifolium, commonly known as the grass-leaved goniolimon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Goniolimon graminifolium is often found in steppe and desert scrub habitats.
